info.title: MVS Licensing API
info.description: Licensing API to be used internally across all of Max Value Software's products.

post.description: Posts a user's login credentials and receives an authentication token.

token.description: Decoded JWT - See external documentation linked at top.

404.description: Page not found. No internet access.

500.description: Internal server error.  Please try again later.

post.description: Performs various checks on HM3 startup such as user token, license, new version, etc.

parameters.name: User-Authorization
parameters.description: The user token as received from /authenticate/user POST

403.description: Expired or invalid user token. Re-authenticate to receive a new token

404.description: Page not found. No internet access. Use existing license on file (if valid) otherwise deny access.

408.description: Timed out. No internet access. Use existing license on file (if valid) otherwise deny access.

500.description: Internal server error. Use existing license on file (if valid) otherwise deny access.

get.description: Is a new trial available to start for this user and product?

parameters.description: The user token as received from /authenticate/user POST

parameters.name: fingerprint
parameters.description: HM3 unique fingerprint of machine.

parameters.name: idProduct
parameters.description: Is a new trial available to start for this product?

300.description: A new trial is not available to start for this product.

parameters.name: User-Authorization
parameters.description: The user token as received from /authenticate/user POST.  Is the user deleted.

404.description: Failed to delete user.  Try again and if error persists, contact admin.

405.description: Deleting user is not permitted.  Only users created via /appdev/user can be deleted.

500.description: Internal server error. Try again later.

post.description: (Dev/Staging Only) Reset the test user's license back to it's intended state.

parameters.name: User-Authorization
parameters.description: The user token as received from /authenticate/user POST.  Is the user license reset.

500.description: Internal server error. Try again later.

MVS_HMAC.name: Authorization
MVS_HMAC.description:
### MVS HMAC Authorization



#### Before You Begin

Please contact the API creator, via the contact information at the top of
this document, to receive three application specific items:

+ Token

+ Secret Key

+ Digest Type (SHA256, SHA372, or SHA512)

#### Authorization Header

Each request made to the API must include an 'Authorization' header in the
format:

`Authorization: scheme token:nonce:signature`

+ _scheme_: This will alwasy be 'MVS'

+ _token_: The application specific token provided to you before you
began.

+ _nonce_: This is a unique string that differs with each request.

+ _signature_: HMAC signature of the request.  (See 'Signing The Request')



#### Other Headers

In addition to the Authorization header, the following headers should also
bet set:

+ _Date_: Date of the request in UTC/GMT.  Example: `Date: Tue, 15 Nov 1994
08:12:31 GMT`

+ _Content-MD5_: Base 64 encoded MD5 hash of the posted content.  For get
request this is empty. Example: `Content-MD5:
MDk4ZjZiY2Q0NjIxZDM3M2NhZGU0ZTgzMjYyN2I0ZjY=`

+ _Content-Type_: THe type of content for the API to consume.  This will
typically be `Content-Type: application/json` or `Content-Type:
text/xml`.  For GET requests, either is fine.

+ _Content-Length_: The length of the posted content.  For requests with no
post data, this should be 0.  Example: `Content-Length: 0`



#### Signing The Request

The Authorization header consists of a signature.  This signature
conctatenates several fields together to form a string to sign (See String
to Sign).  The string is then hashed via the Digest Type (SHA256, SHA372,
or SHA512) using the provided Secret Key and then base 64 encoded to form
the final siganture for the Authorization header.



##### String to Sign

The string that must be signed is the following data contatenated in this
order:

1. Upper case request method.  One of: GET, POST, PUT, DELETE or PATCH

2. The `Content-MD5` header value.

3. The `Content-Type` header value.

4. The `Date` header value.

5. The nonce.  (See 'nonce' in the Authorization Header section)

6. URI.  The URI of the request (including query string).  Example: the URI for the request made to
https://api.maxvaluesoftware.com/licensing/v1/authenticate/user is
"/licensing/v1/authenticate/user"

x-hmac-header.Date: Date of the request in UTC/GMT.  Example: Tue, 15 Nov 1994 08:12:31 GMT

x-hmac-header.Content-MD5: MD5 hash of the posted content.

x-hmac-authorization_fields.nonce: Unique string generated with each request.

x-hmac-authorization_fields.signature: HMAC signature of the request.  Concatenate x-hmac-signature-fields then signed with private application key.

token.description: Decoded JWT - See external documentation linked at top.

dynamicContent.description: Dynamic content installed versions on users machine.

id_message.description: The message id/name that is snoozed.

snoozed_until.description: The message is snoozed until this date (GMT).  null = Not snoozed or no longer snoozed.

url.description: The URL to download the file

signature.description: OpenSSL signature of the license to verify it has not been tampered with.  (See external docs - Application License)

dynamicContent.description: New versions of content that the client should download and update.

expires_local.description: This license is valid locally until this date.

apps.description: For Third Party Apps using API

restrictions.description: Probably not needed.  Instead check items restrictions.

date_expires.description: Product expires at this time (if applicable)

date_buffer_expires.description: If we want to provide a buffer this is when it expires (if applicable).  (If set this should override date-expires to cut off the product/service)

abbrev.description: Third Party App abbreviation.  (Useful for prefixing registered data)

app_id.description: The encrypted secret app id that is used to verify third party apps upon registration. (See external docs)

app_key.description: The encrypted key, used in conjuction with the private key to decrypt the app_id. (See external docs)

date_expires.description: The third party app expires at this time (if applicable)

expiration_message.description: Trial or license expiration message to be displayed to user.

download_url.description: URL to download the latest version

launch_cmd.description: Launch command to launch the app

launch_args.description: Optional arguments to pass to the launch_cmd

post_processing.description: Optional script to execute after install.

is_developer.description: Developers have special third party app privileges.

is_active.description: Is this an active license for an app?

app_handles_expiration.description: Does the app handle its own expiration?

message.description: If not then the tracker should display this message.

applicationLicenseDynamicContent.description: Content that the client should download and update.

url.description: URL to download the latest version of the content

channel.description: Release channel to check for updates.  (Alpha, Beta, Stable)

snoozed_duration.description: How long (in units) to snooze the message.

startTrial.description: Start a trial for the following product(s).

createLicense.description: Create a new license or add paid product(s) to a license

type:.description: The type of restriction.  i.e.) RestrictStakes

value.description: Restriction value i.e.) 1.00 (to restrict to NL 0.50/1.00 and below)

unit.description: Restriction unit.  i.e.) USD  Restricts to value in USD

idProduct.description: The product id to remove the restriction.

username.description: Username of user being created.  (Not needed for HM)

first_name.description: First name of user being created.

last_name.description: Last name of user being created.

messageType.description: Type of message.  i.e. new version, announcement, personal message, etc.

fingerprint.description: A unique fingerprint for the computer

text.description: The text to be displayed for the link.  If null, display the URL instead of text.
